column3: She always got the best grades out of her friends.
column4: One week, however, she became very ill.
column5: She was behind in her studies.
column6: Paige decided to play in the snow,
column7: Paige had to rely on the support of her friends.

column2: One day John met a cute girl named Jessica.
column3: He loved talking to her and spending time with her.
column4: John asked Jessica to go on a date with him.
column5: She agreed and they had a good time.
column6: John was angry that they were doing so badly.
column7: John was glad he'd asked her out.

column2: A flute lying on a shelf covered in dust.
column3: One day a man comes into the shop and takes it home.
column4: This man is dusting.
column5: A song starts playing.
column6: The man didn't like music.
column7: The flute sounded beautiful.

column2: Maggie was scared and looking forward to riding Space Mountain.
column3: She and her mother waited in line for two hours.
column4: When the line shortened, they both got to the front.
column5: They got into their cars and fastened their seat belts.
column6: Maggie was glad the wait in line was so short.
column7: The ride was very fun for Maggie.

column2: All my friends like to go dancing at the club.
column3: They think it's fun, and they always invite.
column4: Last Saturday I finally decided to join.
column5: I was dancing terribly and broke my friend's toe.
column6: My friends have decided to keep inviting me out because I'm a lot of fun.
column7: The next weekend I was asked to stay home.

column2: Avery was married and had children.
column3: She was tired of her boring life.
column4: One day she decided to meet up with her ex-boyfriend from college.
column5: That night she made a bad decision and was unfaithful to her husband.
column6: Avery thought her kids would be happy with her decision.
column7: The next day, Avery regretted what she had done.

column2: John wrote the lyrics for his new album.
column3: He started having writer's block.
column4: He tried to force himself to write, but it did nothing.
column5: He took walks, spent time with friends and observed nature.
column6: He felt inspired and returned home to write.
column7: John then got the idea for his painting.

column2: There was one extremely obnoxious kid in Kerry's economics class.
column3: He monopolized every class discussion with his mediocre ideas.
column4: The professor could never get him to shut up.
column5: One day he came to class with laryngitis.
column6: Kerry was disappointed.
column7: Kerry was so grateful!

column2: Brandon was assigned to write a ten-page research paper in an hour.
column3: He started working on the article on his 2003 Dell laptop.
column4: Brandon stayed up until 1:00 a.m. to try to finish the job.
column5: Suddenly, his computer crashed and died.
column6: When he had finished his work, he went to bed.
column7: Fortunately, he saved everything on an external drive.

column2: Ari spends $20 a day on pickles.
column3: He decides to make his own to save money.
column4: He was pickling cucumbers in brine.
column5: Ari waits two weeks for his pickles to sour.
column6: Ari opens the jar and finds the perfect pickles.
column7: Ari's pickles are sweet.

column2: Trudey wanted to write novels for a living.
column3: She wrote one of them by traditional publishing means.
column4: She barely made enough to cover the advance she got.
column5: She wrote others through her own publishing house.
column6: Trudey hoped that self-publishing would be more profitable.
column7: Trudey called her sister and invited her to dinner.

column2: Oliver was nervous about his wedding.
column3: He was afraid he would stutter on the vow.
column4: When the time came, he took a deep breath and began to speak.
column5: He stammered, but his wife smiled and hugged him and he was fine.
column6: Oliver decided not to get married.
column7: Oliver was very grateful for his wife's love.

column2: Sara's cat is missing.
column3: She was so sad!
column4: She put up signs all over the neighborhood.
column5: Then an amazing thing happened.
column6: Sarah broke her leg.
column7: Someone found her cat.

column2: Kelly was playing her new Mario game.
column3: She played it for weeks.
column4: She played for so long without surpassing the level.
column5: Finally, she conquered the last level.
column6: Kelly was angry about it.
column7: Kelly was so happy to finally beat her.

column2: When I was a kid, I really wanted to play checkers.
column3: I sat down with my grandfather and he taught me.
column4: At first he was just teaching me, but then it became a strange thing.
column5: When I was older, I continued to play checkers with him.
column6: I still hate the lady to this day.
column7: I have very fond memories of the lady.

column2: Ivy wanted a cell phone like all her friends.
column3: She saved her money from delivering newspapers.
column4: Soon she had enough money for a phone.
column5: She went shopping and picked out the perfect phone.
column6: Amy spent all her money on clothes.
column7: She liked the new phone.

column2: Dave walked into the grocery store.
column3: He wanted to buy his favorite energy drink there.
column4: He only had enough money for one can.
column5: He reached the alley and what he saw made him smile.
column6: Dave bought the whole box.
column7: They were on sale.

column2: Ramona was very unhappy in her job.
column3: She asked for a raise but was denied.
column4: The rejection prompted her to start aggressively browsing the classifieds.
column5: She found an interesting new opportunity and set up an interview.
column6: She was offered a new job with a higher salary.
column7: Ramona had no reason to change jobs.

column2: I wanted to buy a game console.
column3: I asked my parents and they came up with an idea.
column4: They told me that if I fulfilled my obligations, I would get money for savings.
column5: I did chores every week all summer without being asked.
column6: My parents gave me enough money to buy a console.
column7: At the end of the summer I returned the money to my parents.
